metadata.title: CVE-2016-10712 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
In PHP before 5.5.32, 5.6.x before 5.6.18, and 7.x before 7.0.3, all of thereturn values of stream_get_meta_data can be controlled if the input can becontrolled (e.g., during file uploads). For example, a "$uri =stream_get_meta_data(fopen($file, "r"))['uri']" call mishandles the casewhere $file is data:text/plain;uri=eviluri, -- in other words, metadata canbe set by an attacker.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10712` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.24
libapache2-mod-php5filter - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.24
libphp5-embed - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.24
php-pear - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.24
php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.24
php5-cgi - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.24

php5-pgsql - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.24
php5-pspell - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.24
php5-readline - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.24

php5-sqlite - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.24
php5-sybase - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.24

php5-xsl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.24
No subscription required

criterions.comment: php5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.24').
